review: Having many students from India and Pakistan the course was enriched with a great deal of local knowledge. \r\n\r\nDiscussions were vivid and interesting. The guest speakers should be chosen more carefully.

course_name: Dynamics of Literature I: Traditional Models
review: You will actually get lost in the works you cover for this class, which is a good thing.

course_name: USC - Perspectives on Creativity in Nature, Art, and Society
review: Considering this is a USC, there is too much emphasis on the art section of the class. That needs to be addressed.
Great professor, great course! The discussion proposal are a bit tedious but they teach you a lot.
Really helpful! Lara Christianson is such a nice, helpful lady.

course_name: The Logic of Comparative Research - Case Studies
review: Prof. Schreier is a very talented lecturer, she explains concepts really well. Always enjoyed her classes.

Mind blowing course. As a CS student I had great challenges to understand completely what is discussed here, but the little I understood was very interesting.\r\n\r\nIf you really like math, take it, but be prepared to devote a lot of time to understand things properly.
haha biggest bullshit ever - every single instructor epitomizes inability and I feel sorry for their sad and meaningless "jobs"
Very interesting if you're interested in experimental techniques. Prof. Fritz's nice teaching style will definitely keep you captivated. Definitely recommend as a specialization course.
